answers.author: William Underwood
answers.text:
We establish a range for unreserved fund balance between 25-30%.  Anything over 30% must be used for capital acquisition in the subsequent fiscal year appropriation.  The policy is contained within our adopted budget.  I believe we will be updating the policy during this next budget cycle to accomodate the new fund balance reporting model.  You can review it at www.oaklandparkfl.org

Mr. Gall, Chapter 129.01(2) (c) (1) of the Florida Statutes provides that a reserve for contingencies may be provided in a sum not to exceed ten percent of the total budget and in (2) a reserve of 20 percent of the operating budget may be held as of Oct. 1 to carry the County through the initial months until revenues come in.


Mr. Gall, Chapter 129.01(2) (c) (1) of the Florida Statutes provides that a reserve for contingencies may be provided in a sum not to exceed ten percent of the total budget and in (2) a reserve of 20 percent of the operating budget may be held as of Oct. 1 to carry the County through the initial months until revenues come in.

answers.author: Michael Walker
answers.text:
The City of Brentwood, TN policy is a minimum unreserved fund balance of 40% (3+ months operating expenses) plus one year of debt service payments in reserve for next year's G.O. obligated debt. We have Aaa and AAA ratings from Moody's and S&P. In our periodic reviews with the rating agencies prior to issuing new bonds, we always receive positive feedback on consistently following this policy.

answers.author: Jay Gsell
answers.text:
Genesee County's Gen Fund guidance is 10% of "A" fund for undesignated, unreserved $ . We also maintain Health care self funded reserve equal to 3 month claims and a Self retained 6 month reserve for possible catastrophic claims. we also have a $1million SIR for property liability /vehicles and professional liability as part of a NYS pool Municipal reciprocal we are in. In this State , having a "real " fund balance for the Gen Fund is a chore because on any given month our State has almost 50% of our Cash sitting in Albany waiting for reimbursement to us because they are broke , operate on a cash basis and still somehow think that we are the Empire St.
